thread.title: Czech caretaker PM Babis says to be appointed as PM again on June 6

title: Czech caretaker PM Babis says to be appointed as PM again on June 6
text:
May 31, 2018 / 1:40 PM / Updated 32 minutes ago Czech caretaker PM Babis says to be appointed as PM again on June 6 Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
PRAGUE (Reuters) - Czech Prime Minister Andrej Babis, ruling in a caretaker capacity, will be appointed government leader again on June 6, he said on Thursday after meeting President Milos Zeman. Czech Prime Minister Andrej Babis arrives at a European Union leaders summit in Brussels, Belgium, March 22, 2018. REUTERS/Francois Lenoir
Babisâ€™s ANO party has struck a deal to form a new government coalition with the centre-left Social Democrats. The deal still awaits approval by Social Democrat members and would also require the parliamentary votes of the far-left Communist party.
ANO had failed to win parliamentary confidence for its current minority one-party government in January. Babis told reporters he expected a new confidence vote to take place after July 10. Reporting by Jan Lopatka and Jason Hovet; Editing by Toby Chopra
